poets.name: William Shakespeare
poets.biography: William Shakespeare was an English playwright, poet, and actor, widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language and the world's greatest dramatist.

poets.name: Emily Dickinson
notable_works: Because I could not stop for Death
Hope is the thing with feathers
poets.biography: Emily Dickinson was an American poet known for her unique and innovative style of poetry. Though she lived a reclusive life, her poems have since become highly regarded for their profound insights and emotional depth.

poets.name: Edgar Allan Poe
poets.biography: Edgar Allan Poe was an American writer, poet, and literary critic. He is best known for his macabre and Gothic tales and poems, which have greatly influenced the horror genres.

poets.name: William Wordsworth
notable_works: Lines Composed a Few Miles Above Tintern Abbey
I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud
poets.biography: William Wordsworth was an English Romantic poet who, with Samuel Taylor Coleridge, helped launch the Romantic Age in English literature. His poetry emphasizes nature, imagination, and the human spirit.

poets.name: John Keats
poets.biography: John Keats was an English Romantic poet known for his odes and sonnets. His poetry is characterized by its sensuous imagery and exploration of the beauty of the natural world.

poets.name: Walt Whitman
notable_works: When Lilacs Last in the Dooryard Bloom'd
poets.biography: Walt Whitman was an American poet, essayist, and journalist. He is best known for his collection 'Leaves of Grass', which celebrates the beauty of nature, the individual, and the human experience.

poets.name: E.E. Cummings
notable_works: i carry your heart with me
somewhere i have never travelled, gladly beyond
poets.biography: E.E. Cummings was an American poet, painter, essayist, and playwright. His poetry is known for its innovative style, experimentation with language, and use of lowercase letters and unconventional punctuation. Cummings' unique approach to poetry has made him one of the most distinctive voices in American literature.

poets.name: Langston Hughes
poets.biography: Langston Hughes was an American poet, social activist, novelist, and playwright. He was a leading figure of the Harlem Renaissance, and his poetry often explored the experiences of African Americans and the complexities of identity and race in America.

poets.name: Rumi
poets.biography: Rumi, also known as Jalāl al-Dīn Muḥammad Rūmī, was a 13th-century Persian poet, Islamic scholar, theologian, and Sufi mystic. His poetry is deeply spiritual and explores themes of love, unity, and the divine.

poets.name: Maya Angelou
notable_works: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
poets.biography: Maya Angelou was an American poet, memoirist, and civil rights activist. Her autobiographical works and poetry reflect her experiences as an African American woman and explore themes of racism, identity, and personal growth.

poets.name: Sylvia Plath
poets.biography: Sylvia Plath was an American poet, novelist, and short story writer. Her poetry is known for its intense and confessional style, exploring themes of mental illness, gender roles, and personal struggle.

poets.name: Rabindranath Tagore
poets.biography: Rabindranath Tagore, also known as Gurudev, was an Indian poet, philosopher, and Nobel laureate. He was a key figure of the Bengal Renaissance and is best known for his poetry, which reflects his deep love for nature and humanity.

poets.name: Christina Rossetti
poets.biography: Christina Rossetti was an English poet of the Victorian era. Her poetry is known for its rich symbolism, religious themes, and lyrical style.

poets.name: Robert Frost
notable_works: Stopping by Woods on a Snowy Evening
poets.biography: Robert Frost was an American poet known for his vivid depictions of rural life and the New England landscape. His poetry often explored themes of nature, human struggles, and the complexities of the human mind. Frost's accessible style and use of everyday language endeared him to readers of all ages.

poets.name: Seamus Heaney
poets.biography: Seamus Heaney was an Irish poet, playwright, and translator. He is considered one of the greatest poets of the 20th century and was renowned for his lyrical and evocative use of language. Heaney's poetry often explored themes of Irish history, rural life, and the complexities of human emotions.

poets.name: Anne Sexton
poets.biography: Anne Sexton was an American poet known for her confessional style and candid exploration of personal experiences and emotions. Her poetry often delved into themes of mental illness, family, and relationships. Sexton's bold and honest approach to writing continues to resonate with readers today.

poets.name: Patti Smith
poets.biography: Patti Smith is an American poet, singer-songwriter, and visual artist. She gained fame in the punk rock movement and is known for her poetic lyrics and unique blend of rock and poetry in her music.

writers.name: William Shakespeare
writers.biography: William Shakespeare was an English playwright, poet, and actor, widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language and the world's greatest dramatist.

writers.name: Leo Tolstoy
writers.award: Nominated for Nobel Prize in Literature
writers.biography: Leo Tolstoy was a Russian writer who is regarded as one of the greatest authors of all time. His epic novels are considered masterpieces of world literature.

writers.name: Mark Twain
writers.biography: Mark Twain, pen name of Samuel Langhorne Clemens, was an American writer known for his humor and satirical wit. He is best remembered for his novels about adventurous boys growing up along the Mississippi River.

writers.name: Herman Melville
writers.biography: Herman Melville was an American novelist, short story writer, and poet. He is best known for his novel 'Moby-Dick,' considered one of the greatest works of American literature.

writers.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
writers.biography: Fyodor Dostoevsky was a Russian novelist, philosopher, and journalist. His works explore human psychology, ethics, and the dark aspects of the human psyche.

writers.name: Charles Dickens
writers.biography: Charles Dickens was an English writer and social critic. He created some of the world's best-known fictional characters and is regarded as one of the greatest novelists of the Victorian era.

writers.name: Gustave Flaubert
writers.biography: Gustave Flaubert was a French novelist known for his contributions to literary realism. His novel 'Madame Bovary' is considered one of the greatest works in the history of fiction.

writers.name: Edgar Allan Poe
notable_works: The Fall of the House of Usher
writers.biography: Edgar Allan Poe was an American writer, poet, and literary critic. He is best known for his macabre and Gothic tales and his influential contributions to the development of the mystery and horror genres.

writers.name: Mary Shelley
writers.biography: Mary Shelley was an English novelist best known for her novel 'Frankenstein,' which is considered one of the earliest works of science fiction.

writers.name: Emily Dickinson
notable_works: The Complete Poems of Emily Dickinson
writers.biography: Emily Dickinson was an American poet known for her innovative use of language and her unconventional approach to poetry. She is considered one of the most important poets in American literature.

writers.name: Jane Austen
writers.biography: Jane Austen was an English novelist known primarily for her six major novels, which interpret, critique, and comment upon the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

writers.name: Harper Lee
writers.biography: Harper Lee was an American novelist known for her novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird,' a classic of modern American literature. She received the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction for this novel.

writers.name: Agatha Christie
writers.biography: Agatha Christie was an English writer known for her detective novels and short stories. She is often called the 'Queen of Mystery' and is one of the best-selling authors in history.

writers.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
writers.biography: J.R.R. Tolkien was an English writer, poet, philologist, and university professor. He is best known for his high-fantasy works, 'The Hobbit' and 'The Lord of the Rings,' which have had a major impact on the fantasy genres.

writers.name: Virginia Woolf
writers.biography: Virginia Woolf was an English writer and one of the foremost modernists of the 20th century. She is known for her innovative narrative techniques and her exploration of the inner lives of her characters.

writers.name: James Joyce
notable_works: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man
writers.biography: James Joyce was an Irish novelist and poet, regarded as one of the most influential modernist writers of the 20th century. His novel 'Ulysses' is considered one of the greatest works of literature.

writers.name: George Bernard Shaw
writers.biography: George Bernard Shaw was an Irish playwright, critic, and polemicist. He was a prominent figure in the Fabian Society and a leading playwright of the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

writers.name: George Orwell
notable_works: Down and Out in Paris and London
writers.biography: George Orwell, pen name of Eric Arthur Blair, was an English novelist, essayist, and critic. He is best known for his dystopian novel 'Nineteen Eighty-Four,' which has become a classic of modern literature.

writers.name: Rabindranath Tagore
writers.biography: Rabindranath Tagore was an Indian poet, philosopher, and writer. He was the first non-European to be awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature, primarily for his collection of poems 'Gitanjali.'

writers.name: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
notable_works: Love in the Time of Cholera
writers.biography: Gabriel Garcia Marquez was a Colombian novelist and Nobel laureate, best known for his magical realism and portrayal of Latin American life.

writers.name: Haruki Murakami
writers.biography: Haruki Murakami is a Japanese novelist and translator. He is considered one of the most significant contemporary authors and has gained international acclaim for his unique storytelling style.

writers.name: J.D. Salinger
writers.biography: J.D. Salinger was an American writer known for his novel 'The Catcher in the Rye,' which has become a classic of modern American literature.

writers.name: Franz Kafka
writers.biography: Franz Kafka was a Czech writer known for his surreal and complex narratives. His works have had a profound influence on literature and continue to captivate readers with their enigmatic themes.

writers.name: Aldous Huxley
writers.biography: Aldous Huxley was an English writer and philosopher known for his dystopian novel 'Brave New World.' He also explored spiritual and philosophical themes in his works.

writers.name: Hermann Hesse
writers.biography: Hermann Hesse was a German-born Swiss poet, novelist, and painter. He is best known for his novels that explore themes of spirituality and self-discovery.

writers.name: Kurt Vonnegut
writers.biography: Kurt Vonnegut was an American writer known for his satirical novels that blend science fiction, dark humor, and social commentary.

writers.name: Octavia E. Butler
writers.biography: Octavia E. Butler was an American science fiction writer, considered one of the most significant voices in the genres. She was the first science fiction writer to receive the MacArthur Fellowship.

writers.name: Albert Camus
writers.biography: Albert Camus was a French philosopher, author, and journalist. He is known for his philosophical works and novels that explore themes of existentialism and the absurd.

writers.name: John Steinbeck
writers.biography: John Steinbeck was an American author known for his realistic and socially conscious novels, including 'The Grapes of Wrath,' which earned him the Nobel Prize in Literature.

writers.name: Ernest Hemingway
notable_works: The Old Man and the Sea
writers.biography: Ernest Hemingway was an American novelist, short story writer, and journalist. He is considered one of the most influential writers of the 20th century and was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature.

writers.name: Oscar Wilde
writers.biography: Oscar Wilde was an Irish playwright, poet, and author. He is best known for his plays and novel 'The Picture of Dorian Gray,' which are celebrated for their wit and social commentary.

writers.name: Jorge Luis Borges
writers.biography: Jorge Luis Borges was an Argentine writer and one of the most prominent literary figures of the 20th century. His works often explored themes of labyrinths, mirrors, and infinite realities.

writers.name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
writers.biography: F. Scott Fitzgerald was an American novelist and short story writer, widely regarded as one of the greatest American writers of the 20th century.

writers.name: Dante Alighieri
writers.biography: Dante Alighieri was an Italian poet, writer, and philosopher. He is best known for his epic poem 'Divine Comedy,' which is considered a masterpiece of world literature.

writers.name: Yukio Mishima
notable_works: The Temple of the Golden Pavilion
writers.biography: Yukio Mishima was a Japanese author, poet, and playwright. He is considered one of the most important Japanese authors of the 20th century.

writers.name: Margaret Atwood
writers.biography: Margaret Atwood is a Canadian author known for her dystopian and speculative fiction. She is a Booker Prize winner and has received numerous awards for her literary contributions.

writers.name: Zora Neale Hurston
writers.biography: Zora Neale Hurston was an American author, anthropologist, and filmmaker. She is best known for her novel 'Their Eyes Were Watching God,' which is considered a classic of African-American literature.

writers.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
writers.biography: J.R.R. Tolkien was a British writer, poet, philologist, and university professor. He is best known for his high-fantasy works 'The Lord of the Rings' and 'The Hobbit,' which have become classics of the genres.

writers.name: Khaled Hosseini
writers.biography: Khaled Hosseini is an Afghan-American author and physician. He gained international recognition with his debut novel 'The Kite Runner,' which explores themes of friendship, betrayal, and redemption.

writers.name: Ray Bradbury
writers.biography: Ray Bradbury was an American author and screenwriter known for his works in the genres of science fiction, fantasy, and horror. His novel 'Fahrenheit 451' is regarded as a classic of dystopian literature.

writers.name: Toni Morrison
writers.biography: Toni Morrison was an American novelist, essayist, and professor. She was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature for her novels, which gave voice to the African-American experience.

writers.name: J.K. Rowling
notable_works: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
writers.biography: J.K. Rowling is a British author and philanthropist. She is best known for writing the 'Harry Potter' fantasy series, which has won multiple awards and become one of the best-selling book series in history.

books.title: The Brothers Karamazov
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: A complex novel exploring themes of spirituality, morality, and human nature.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: A psychological thriller revolving around guilt, conscience, and redemption.

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.description: A novel about a man whose portrait ages while he retains his youth and beauty.

books.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
books.author: Alexandre Dumas
books.description: An adventure novel of revenge, love, and redemption set in the early 19th century.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A classic novel depicting racial injustice in the American South.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel portraying a totalitarian society.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A classic novel exploring themes of love, marriage, and social norms.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A tale of the American Dream, wealth, and love during the Roaring Twenties.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: The epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsession with the white whale.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: An epic fantasy saga about the quest to destroy the One Ring.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A classic coming-of-age novel following Holden Caulfield's journey.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: The prequel to The Lord of the Rings, following Bilbo Baggins' journey.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
books.description: A multi-generational saga of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A monumental work depicting the events of Russian society during the Napoleonic era.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.description: An ancient Greek epic poem recounting Odysseus' ten-year journey home after the Trojan War.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.description: An epic poem that follows the journey of the soul through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A dystopian vision of a future society obsessed with pleasure and conformity.

books.title: Anna Karenina
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A tragic love story set against the backdrop of Russian high society.

books.title: The Alchemist
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.description: A philosophical novel about a shepherd boy's journey to find his personal legend.

books.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
books.author: Mark Twain
books.description: A satirical novel following Huck Finn's journey down the Mississippi River.

books.title: The Iliad
books.author: Homer
books.description: An ancient Greek epic poem about the Trojan War and the hero Achilles.

books.title: Don Quixote
books.author: Miguel de Cervantes
books.description: A satirical novel about a deluded knight and his faithful squire, Sancho Panza.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.description: A novel about the creation of a monster and the consequences of playing god.

books.title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.description: A whimsical tale about a girl named Alice who falls into a magical world.

books.title: The Little Prince
books.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
books.description: A philosophical novella about a young prince's journey through the universe.

books.title: The Book Thief
books.author: Markus Zusak
books.description: A story of a girl living in Nazi Germany, narrated by Death.

books.title: Slaughterhouse-Five
books.author: Kurt Vonnegut
books.description: An anti-war novel that mixes science fiction and dark humor.

books.title: The Grapes of Wrath
books.author: John Steinbeck
books.description: A novel about the plight of migrant workers during the Great Depression.

books.title: Fahrenheit 451
books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.description: A dystopian novel depicting a future society where books are banned.

books.title: The Lord of the Flies
books.author: William Golding
books.description: A novel about a group of British boys stranded on an uninhabited island.

books.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
books.author: Douglas Adams
books.description: A comedic science fiction series about the misadventures of Arthur Dent.

books.title: A Tale of Two Cities
books.author: Charles Dickens
books.description: A historical novel set during the French Revolution, exploring themes of sacrifice and resurrection.

books.title: The Chronicles of Narnia
books.author: C.S. Lewis
books.description: A series of fantasy novels set in the magical land of Narnia.

books.title: The Handmaid's Tale
books.author: Margaret Atwood
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where women are subjugated.

books.title: The Name of the Rose
books.author: Umberto Eco
books.description: A medieval mystery novel set in an Italian monastery.

books.title: The Trial
books.author: Franz Kafka
books.description: A surreal novel exploring themes of guilt, law, and justice.

books.title: The Kite Runner
books.author: Khaled Hosseini
books.description: A novel about friendship, redemption, and the impact of war in Afghanistan.

books.title: The Pillars of the Earth
books.author: Ken Follett
books.description: An epic historical novel set in 12th-century England, centered around the construction of a cathedral.

books.title: The Shadow of the Wind
books.author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
books.description: A mystery novel set in post-war Barcelona, revolving around a forgotten book and its author.

books.title: The Secret Garden
books.author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
books.description: A classic children's novel about a young girl who discovers a hidden garden.

books.title: The Giver
books.author: Lois Lowry
books.description: A dystopian novel about a society with strict control over emotions and memories.

books.title: The Metamorphosis
books.author: Franz Kafka
books.description: A novella about a man who wakes up one morning transformed into a giant insect.

books.title: Gone with the Wind
books.author: Margaret Mitchell
books.description: A historical novel set during the American Civil War, centered around Scarlett O'Hara.

books.title: The Wind in the Willows
books.author: Kenneth Grahame
books.description: A children's novel about the adventures of anthropomorphic animals.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.description: A Gothic horror novel about the vampire Count Dracula's attempt to move to England.

books.title: The Call of the Wild
books.author: Jack London
books.description: An adventure novel about a domestic dog's life in the wilds of the Yukon.

books.title: The Stand
books.author: Stephen King
books.description: A post-apocalyptic horror novel about a deadly pandemic and its aftermath.

books.title: The Color Purple
books.author: Alice Walker
books.description: A novel about the life of African-American women in the Southern United States.

books.title: The Silmarillion
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A collection of mythopoeic stories about the history of Middle-earth.

wishlist.title: The Brothers Karamazov
wishlist.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
wishlist.description: A complex novel exploring themes of spirituality, morality, and human nature.

wishlist.title: Crime and Punishment
wishlist.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
wishlist.description: A psychological thriller revolving around guilt, conscience, and redemption.
